Perplex: Who?

He asked Grounded...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From=
: gunthers8@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, J=
une 30, 2001 10:27 PM
  Subject: Re: Chivtron Decisions


  Grounded smiled=
 as an idea came to him.  "No, we should have a 
  alliance, but not with t=
he alliance.  But with a faction that will 
  protect us, because they are =
two honourable to let anything die, 
  catch my drift everyone"

  --- In n=
bwrpg@y..., "Soulstice Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
  > Perplex: Hey, put t=
hat thing away, we shouldn't draw any weapons 
  inside of the base.
  > 
 =
 > Sarge: Don't you see? The weapon is here because I think you might 
  be=
 trying to trick me. Maybe you're really with Deemos, and want to 
  trap m=
e here and kill me. Sorry about that, I don't really believe 
  that, I jus=
t don't know what else to say.
  > 
  > Perplex: Maybe we should just offer=
 to help the Chosen Mafia out in 
  exchange for them not trying to hurt us=
.
  > 
  > Sarge: Are you out of your mind, boy? As soon as we have our bac=
ks 
  turned Deemos will rip our sparks out through our eyes!
  > 
  > Arro=
w: I have to agree on this one. That's the stupidest idea I've 
  ever hear=
d. If we try to side with them, they'll just wait for the 
  opportunity to=
 kill us all. If that happens, I won't be here, because 
  I will have alre=
ady left. I don't want to die until I'm sure I've 
  done everything I can =
to insure your safety, but if you want to 
  condemn yourself, Perplex, how=
 about YOU be the one who ask 
  them? "Hi, Chosen Mafia, I'm Perplex, and =
I was wondering--" BANG! 
  I'm sure we can get along without you Perplex, =
so go on. If that's 
  what you want to do, ask them for an alliance.
  > 
=
  > Sarge: Well said, soldier.
  > 
  > Perplex: You're wrong, Arrow. I thi=
nk that we can really side with 
  their team the Alliance. It would mean j=
oining the evil side, but we 
  can be rid of their attacks forever.
  > 
 =
 > Sarge: Boy, Deemos doesn't stop till he gets what he wants. If we 
  sid=
e with the Alliance, then they'll kill us and walk off.
  > 
  > Perplex: W=
hat's wrong with you anyway?
  > 
  > Sarge: You don't know how tough my li=
fe's been, boy. You have no 
  idea...
  > 
  >   ----- Original Message --=
--- 
  >   From: Soulstice Omega 
  >   To: nbwrpg@y... 
  >   Sent: Saturd=
ay, June 30, 2001 9:23 PM
  >   Subject: Re: Chivtron Decisions
  > 
  > 
 =
 >   Sarge drew his rifle.
  > 
  >   Sarge: Deemos is mine. I'm in charge =
here...
  > 
  >     ----- Original Message ----- 
  >     From: gunthers8@=
n... 
  >     To: nbwrpg@y... 
  >     Sent: Saturday, June 30, 2001 6:58 P=
M
  >     Subject: Re: Chivtron Decisions
  > 
  > 
  > 
  > 
  >     Groun=
ded thought hard for a bit. "All right, I announce now the 
  death 
  >   =
  sentence on Deemos for crimes first and second degree murder.  
  It is 
=
  >     now, your duty to kill him, Aerotaur.  Not a savage grudge, but 
  =
a law 
  >     announced. We will not kill like ancient transformeres.  His=
 so 
  >     called, lackeys, also have a death sentence for protecting 
  =
aiding a 
  >     fellons escape.  Does this suit you both."
  >     --- In=
 nbwrpg@y..., airly2000@y... wrote:
  >     > Trinity::
  >     > 
  >     =
> "When wiull we started to train Uncle Aerotaur?????" said 
  Trinity
  > =
    > 
  >     > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
  >     > > ::Aer=
otaur::
  >     > >     "I'm sorry Grounded but Deemos has hurt us too many=
 
  times for 
  >     > me to let 
  >     > > him live.  This is all beca=
use I let him go the first time 
  he 
  >     > attacked.  As 
  >     > >=
 for you Sarge, I have just as much reason to kill him.  In 
  our 
  >    =
 last 
  >     > fight I 
  >     > > lost an arm and a leg defending other=
s.  I nearly died 
  because 
  >     > there were 
  >     > > bots in the=
 battle that shouldn't have been there.  I 
  couldn't 
  >     care 
  >  =
   > less 
  >     > > about his lackeys.  Now then, let's get to the meeti=
ng so 
  we can 
  >     > finish it 
  >     > > and start planning our at=
tack."  He stands tall glaring at 
  Sarge.
